column4: I'm running Heron alpha-6 on LiveCD and it is as fast as my 7.10 on harddisk
I know... blkid does exist but it won't print anything
there is something very wrong then,  that would me you hve no partitons on your computer what so ever
oh... I understand... I'm using LiveCD... I want to resize a partition in order to install Heron without deleting Feisty... so I have to update my Feisty /etc/fstab file
that sould not keep blkid from displaying partitons as far as I know
why is the fstab using UUID in stead of using just /dev/sda1
it can use either or both,  uuid will keep partitions identified properly even if you add or remove hdds from your comp
so if I change fstab to use /dev/sda1 instead of UUID it will work properly right?
that I did, but still it takes more than a minute to boot up
